sen.j: 白米山古墳（しらげやまこふん）は、京都府与謝郡与謝野町に所在する前方後円墳である。
sen.e: Shirageyama Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped tomb mound located in Yosano Town, Yosa County, Kyoto Prefecture.
Shirageyama Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped tomb mound located in Yosano Town, Yosa County, Kyoto Prefecture.
Shirageyama Tumulus is a keyhole-shaped tomb mound located in Yosano-cho, Yosa-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 全長92m、高さ5mの日本海側最古の前方後円墳であり、4世紀頃に築かれた。
sen.e: The 92 m-long and 52 m-high tumulus, built in around fourth century, is the oldest keyhole-shaped tomb mound on the Japan Sea side
The 92 m-long and 52 m-high tumulus, built around the fourth century, is the oldest keyhole-shaped tomb mound on the Japan Sea side
The 92 m-long and 5 m-high tumulus, built around the fourth century, is the oldest keyhole-shaped tomb mound on the Japan Sea side

sen.j: 墳丘は2段に造られている。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 埴輪はないものの葺石は残されている。
sen.e: Althoug no Haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs (kofun)) is found there, some fuki-ishi (stones covering an old tomb) still remain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Althoug no Haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs or kofun) is found there, some fuki-ishi (stones covering an old tomb) still remain.
Although no Haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs or kofun) is found there, some fuki-ishi (stones covering an old tomb) still remain.
